Text: These two are both version 143u6, to clarify :)

Command-line users:
This build works with command line, but if you are seeing the GUI and don't want to, it can be disabled.
To disable the GUI, add " -verbose" or " -v" (minus the quotes, note the space) to the command.
Normally this would display diagnostic information, but it also disables the GUI.

example:

mame bublbobl -v

...would run Bubble Bobble with no GUI.

To create a .INI file to manually configure MAME options, add " -createconfig" or " -cc" to the target box in a shortcut to the MAME exe, and run it. The .INI will be created in the same directory.

For command line build:

download the source from the release topic: http://www.retroroms.net/modules/newbb/viewtopic.php?topic_id=6204&forum=3

and remove the OSD=winui from the compile32.bat (or compile64.bat) and then recompile the source using the official dev tools from mamedev.org
Thank you, MasterFasterVDOWN, I did not know any of that information... very valuable :)
